title: sessioncheck

title: sessioncheck

what: Checks the overall status of the R session — check_session
title: Checks the overall status of the R session — check_session
text: Individual session check functions inspect one way R session considered "clean". Session checkers can produce errors, warnings, messages requested.

title: Checks the overall status of the R session — check_session
code: check_session(   action = "warn",   checks = c("globalenv", "packages", "namespaces", "attachments"),   settings = getOption("sessioncheck.settings") )

title: Checks the overall status of the R session — check_session
text: action Behaviour take status clean. Possible values "error", "warn", "message", "none". default action = "warn". checks Character vector listing checks run. default run checks = c("globalenv", "packages", "attachments", "namespaces") settings list specifying rules applied individual checks

title: Checks the overall status of the R session — check_session
text: Invisibly returns status object, list named logical vectors. vector names refer detected entities specific check. Values TRUE entity ignored, FALSE triggers action.

title: Checks the overall status of the R session — check_session
text: check_session() allows user apply multiple session checks single function

title: Checks the overall status of the R session — check_session
code: check_session(action = "message") #> Session checks found the following issues: #> - Attached packages: sessioncheck #> - Loaded namespaces: jsonlite, xml2, jquerylib, textshaping, and 39 more

what: Check specific aspects to the R session — sessionchecks
title: Check specific aspects to the R session — sessionchecks
text: Individual session check functions inspect one way R session considered "clean". Session checkers can produce errors, warnings, messages requested.

title: Check specific aspects to the R session — sessionchecks
code: check_globalenv(action = "warn", ignore = NULL)  check_packages(action = "warn", ignore = NULL)  check_namespaces(action = "warn", ignore = NULL)  check_attachments(action = "warn", ignore = NULL)

title: Check specific aspects to the R session — sessionchecks
text: action Behaviour take status clean. Possible values "error", "warn", "message", "none". default action = "warn". ignore Character vector containing names objects, packages, environment names trigger action. entities never trigger actions (see details).

title: Check specific aspects to the R session — sessionchecks
text: Invisibly returns status vector, logical vector names referring detected entity (e.g., object, package, environment). Values TRUE entity ignored, FALSE triggers action.

title: Check specific aspects to the R session — sessionchecks
text: default behaviour ignore argument slightly checker: check_globalenv(): checker inspects state global environment takes action based objects found . ignore = NULL, variables global environment ignored name starts dot. example, .Random.seed .Last.value trigger actions default. check_packages(): checker inspects list packages attached search path (e.g., via library()). Regardless value ignore, R packages "base" priority (e.g., base, utils, grDevices) trigger action. ignore = NULL packages ignored. check_namespaces(): checker inspects list loaded namespaces (e.g. packages loaded attached). ignore argument checker almost identical check_packages(): difference sessioncheck package never flagged, since namespace must loaded order call function. check_attachments(): checker inspects environments search path. includes attached packages, anything added using attach(), global environment. ignore = NULL, package environents trigger action, "tools:rstudio", "tools:positron", "Autoloads". global environment package environment base package never trigger actions.

title: Check specific aspects to the R session — sessionchecks
code: check_packages(action = "message") #> Found packages: sessioncheck check_namespaces(action = "message") #> Found namespaces: jsonlite, xml2, jquerylib, textshaping, and 39 more check_globalenv(action = "message") check_attachments(action = "message")
